meanings.definition: Have an unfavorable opinion of something.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disapproves when students talk during class.
meanings.sent3: The cat disapproves of the new brand of food by refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: His father's stern look disapproves louder than any words.
meanings.sent5: The judge's raised eyebrow clearly disapproves of the defendant's actions.

meanings.sent1: He disapproves by shaking his head.
meanings.sent2: The crowd disapproves of the politician's decision.
meanings.sent3: The dog disapproves of bath time by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her silence disapproves of his rude comment.
meanings.sent5: The disappointed frown on her face disapproves of the outcome.
